alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 29 at 11:17PM CDT until August 30 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, northern Taylor. This includes the city of Abilene. * WHEN...Until 115 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1114 PM CDT, radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms with very heavy rain over northern and northeastern Taylor County, including in the city of Abilene. Rainfall of 1 to 2 inches has already occurred across parts of the Abilene area. An additional 1 to 1.5 inches is expected. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Abilene, Wylie, Tye, Dyess Afb, Potosi, Impact and Kirby Lake. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 274 and 291. This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Intersections along Sammons Street, Butternut Underpass, Curry Lane from Clack Street to Catclaw Drive, Texas Avenue at Arnold Boulevard, Intersections along Buttonwillow Parkway, South 27th Street at Catclaw Creek, FM 3308 crossing Draw, 2000 block of Oak Street, North 6th Street and Willis and Antilley Rd. crossing Button Willow Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
